definition: lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: He refined the whole art of shuttle diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 他把穿梭外交藝術發展到爐火純青的地步。

sentences.english: It really reaches to the high degree of professional proficiency, when we watch our master Feng practiced sword form.
sentences.chinese: 我們看馮老師練劍，真是達到了“爐火純青”。

sentences.english: The formal beauty and the film language were expressed in a very natural way.
sentences.chinese: 電影語言和形式上的美感結合得爐火純青。

definition: to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
